claim: Henry VIII of England had personal extravagance and was criticized.
LM: He is frequently characterised in his later life as a lustful , egotistical , harsh , and insecure king . He was an extravagant spender and used the proceeds from the Dissolution of the Monasteries and acts of the Reformation Parliament to convert into royal revenue the money that was formerly paid to Rome . Despite the influx of money from these sources , Henry was continually on the verge of financial ruin due to his personal extravagance as well as his numerous costly continental wars , particularly with Francis I of France and the Holy Roman Emperor Charles V , as he sought to enforce his claim to the Kingdom of France .

claim: Whitey Bulger was sentenced by Judge Denise Casper.
